channel.title: Pits = safe zone?
channel.description: im trying to make my fits pits a kind of "fun pking" thing where you dont lose items... but its just like the pking :\ help please.

item.title: Pits = safe zone?
item.dc:creator: @Gh0st_Jr Gh0st Jr
item.description:
@Gh0st_Jr wrote:

very well… Hello, im trying to figure out how to make the fight pits area a pk zone, but you dont lose your items when you die. this is what i have so far. (funpk is where you dont lose your items)

public boolean funPk() { //fight pits where you odnt lose items if ((absX >= 2420 && absX <= 2377 && absY >= 5190 && absY <= 5128) || (absX >= 2420 && absX <= 2377 && absY >= 5190 && absY <= 5128) || heightLevel == 0) { return true; } else { return false; } }
and when you die.

// If killed apply dead if ((absX >= 2420 && absX <= 2377 && absY >= 5190 && absY <= 5128 && IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1)) { NewHP = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); setSkillLevel(3, getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]), playerXP[playerHitpoints]); playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); refreshSkills(); teleportToX = 2399; teleportToY = 5170; sendMessage("You died at Fun Pk."); } else if ((absX >= 2420 && absX <= 2377 && absY >= 5190 && absY <= 5128 && IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1)) { NewHP = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); setSkillLevel(3, getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]), playerXP[playerHitpoints]); playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); refreshSkills(); teleportToX = 2399; teleportToY = 5170; teleblock = false; sendMessage("You died at Fun Pk."); } else if ((absX >= 2420 && absX <= 2377 && absY >= 5190 && absY <= 5128 && IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1)) { NewHP = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); setSkillLevel(3, getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]), playerXP[playerHitpoints]); playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); refreshSkills(); teleportToX = 2399; teleportToY = 5170; teleblock = false; sendMessage("You died at Fun Pk."); }
FUN PK IS WHAT IM CALLING IT!

Read full topic

item.title: Pits = safe zone?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:1, topic:202972”]This means be specific, State what you want clearly, and show the attempts you have made to finding your answer.

http://catb.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html

Edit by TeleNubby:
It seems as if you guys are not understanding the message and meaning behind this post. Therefore, I will elaborate for you.

When you ask a question, pretend we are seven-year-old kids (that’s very easy to do as most of you guys are) that have no idea what’s going on. That’s how much you’ll have to explain. When asking the question, you must clearly ask it, just like Silabsoft said. This means use proper grammer and spelling, as this makes our job easier, and make sure you’re question is understandable.

Next, you’ll have to show us what you’ve already done. THIS IS A MUST! If we want to get anywhere as a community, we’re going to have to quit the spoon-feeding. So if you ask something like “how do I get food healing to work” and show us no previous attempts, you’re not going to get an answer. You may be wondering how a question like this is considered bad. Well, the question asker did not make an attempt to solve the problem him or herself, and is indirectly asking the same question as “tell me how to get food healing work so I can continue my effortless server.” So, remember, show us what you’ve done, what you’ve tried to do, or what you think may work.

After you have all of that, you’ll have to identify the problem. Its not our job to add your snippet into our own servers and test it for any inconveniences, its YOURS. Usually, its a compilation problem, and it can be solved very easily by glancing at the JavaDocs. Something like NullPointerException can be found by typing NullPointerException java.sun in the Google search bar. This will return results with links to the JavaDocs about your problem.

Remember, this is just the bare minimum. Try and keep your questions as elaborate as possible. This will benefit yourself and the community as a whole, as you will be learning in the process and we will be able to help solve your problem faster.[/quote]

Read full topic
